decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.

The mature Pine tree is located in the front garden of the property. It can be seen by road and footpath users, as well as neighbours. It is in good form and holds high environmental, ecological and amenity value.

This is the same request as application: 12560/TRE/2023/304 that was refused previously. Since then no further evidence has been submitted with the application. Due to the trees high amenity value, we will need solid evidence that the tree is the cause of subsidence.
The application is refused due to a lack of evidence showing the Pine to be the cause of any damage.
description: To remove One Pine at T1 within TPO 740
